entry.title: Editorial: stop using identical to in the HTML parser
entry.content:
Editorial: stop using identical to in the HTML parser

Closes #3298.

entry.title: Make hidden input _charset_ checks case insensitive
entry.content:
Make hidden input _charset_ checks case insensitive

Fixes #5914.

entry.title: Editorial: use an explicit argument for navigationType
entry.content: Editorial: use an explicit argument for navigationType

entry.title: Editorial: improve links to "resolve a module specifier" assertions
entry.content:
Editorial: improve links to "resolve a module specifier" assertions

The explanatory text of the assertion in HostResolveImportedModule
stating that "resolve a module specifier" must have been previously
successful lists HostImportModuleDynamically as one of the places where
"resolve a module specifier" would previously have succeeded. However,
it's "fetch() an import() module script graph", called by
HostImportModuleDynamically, where "resolve a module specifier" is
actually called. Update the assertion text to reference "fetch() an
import() module script graph" directly.

The corresponding assertion in "find the first parse error" didn't have
a link to where the prior "resolve a module specifier" call would occur,
so add one.

entry.title: Editorial: rearrange ElementInternals into sections
entry.content:
Editorial: rearrange ElementInternals into sections

As it's grown over time, some more structure seems nice. This also
updates the section to the latest Web IDL conventions, e.g. "this",
"method steps", etc.

entry.title: Add shadowRoot to ElementInternals
entry.content:
Add shadowRoot to ElementInternals

Closes https://github.com/w3c/webcomponents/issues/871.

entry.title: Editorial: WebSocket is not an element
entry.content:
Editorial: WebSocket is not an element

Closes #5992.

entry.title: Meta: Update the dfn panels to match Bikeshed's output more closely
entry.content:
Meta: Update the dfn panels to match Bikeshed's output more closely

This change removes the HTML-specific styles dealing with the dfn
panels, and changes html-dfn.js to have those panels match Bikeshed's
output more closely. The particular changes are:

- Panels have the "dfn-panel" class, rather than "dfnPanel". They also
  have the "on" class, to make them visible.
- Moved panels gain the "activated" class, instead of gaining inline
  styles.
- The elements that can open a dfn panel when clicked now include
  headings with the "data-dfn-type" attribute (corresponding to a "dfn"
  attribute in the source).

See whatwg/whatwg.org#343, which adds Bikeshed's dfn panel styles to
standard.css.

entry.title: Explain placeholder/autofocus interaction for textarea too
entry.content:
Explain placeholder/autofocus interaction for textarea too

Fixes #5828.

entry.title: Revert to doing unloading steps *after* pagehide
entry.content:
Revert to doing unloading steps *after* pagehide

This change reverts 386360c (https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/3957).
Specifically, it reorders two steps in the “unload a document” algorithm such
that the spec once again requires UAs to wait to run any “unloading document
visibility change steps” from other applicable specifications (in particular,
the Page Visibility spec) until *after* firing the pagehide event.

In practice, in combination with requirements in the Page Visibility spec,
this change has the effect of stating that UAs must wait to fire the
visibilitychange event until after the pagehide event has fired. That
ordering matches the behavior current implemented in all engines.

Otherwise, without this change, the ordering of firing for the events
doesn’t match what implementations actually do.

See also:
* https://github.com/w3c/page-visibility/issues/39
* https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/5949#issuecomment-699975210

entry.title: Meta: move merged repository notices to IPR section
entry.content:
Meta: move merged repository notices to IPR section

And also state all the licenses and update the title of the one that already had it stated.

entry.title: Editorial: remove third argument of registerProtocolHandler()
entry.content:
Editorial: remove third argument of registerProtocolHandler()

The argument was removed in af228b2a3018c5ae0f280550ff995905248cc0e5, but the example was not updated to reflect this.

Fixes #5790.

entry.title: Prevent attachInternals() use before custom element constructor
entry.content:
Prevent attachInternals() use before custom element constructor

Change to DOM: https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/894.

Tests: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/25402.

entry.title: Fixup parenthesis placement in previous commit
entry.content:
Fixup parenthesis placement in previous commit

f76d3c5cc1287c372670e4267c439da340e17e24 placed the parenthesis
incorrectly.

Also note that its commit message was incorrect in an important aspect:
public-suffix roots are *not* considered same-site to their subdomains.
Instead the relevant change was that public-suffix roots need to be
compute to the same site as versions of themselves with different ports.

entry.title: Fix definition of site for null-registrable-domain cases
entry.content:
Fix definition of site for null-registrable-domain cases

In particular, different ports on the same IP address need to be
considered same-site, and public-suffix roots need to be considered
same-site to their subdomains.

Closes #5940; see
https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/5940#issuecomment-698424406 in
particular.

Co-authored-by: Anne van Kesteren <annevk@annevk.nl>

entry.title: Meta: migrate to GitHub Actions
entry.content:
Meta: migrate to GitHub Actions

This takes advantage of the new CI build strategy in
https://github.com/whatwg/html-build/pull/254.

Part of https://github.com/whatwg/meta/issues/173.

entry.title: Specify <meta name=color-scheme>
entry.content:
Specify <meta name=color-scheme>

The specification is currently in the CSS Color Adjustment spec [1]. It
was resolved [2] in the CSSWG that it should be moved to the HTML spec,
with a reference [3] from CSS Color Adjustment.

[1]: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-color-adjust/#color-scheme-meta
[2]: https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/3846#issuecomment-648923121
[3]: https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/3846#issuecomment-648924000

entry.title: Meta: properly export global attributes and their values
entry.content:
Meta: properly export global attributes and their values

Closes #5417. Previously many of these were marked up as element-attr,
but without a for="", which is invalid according to the Bikeshed
linking contract. dir="" was especially messed up, with its *values*
marked up as element-attr, but the attribute itself not marked up at
all.

This uses for="global" for any-namespace elements and for="html-global"
for HTML elements.

This includes some other related fixes such as:

* Unifying the inconsistent definition location for these attributes.
  Sometimes they would be defined in their section headers; sometimes
  separately. Now they are all defined separately.

* Marking up some of the related IDL attributes.

* Delegating definitions of xml:space, xml:lang, and the style IDL
  attribute to other specifications, instead of re-defining them in
  HTML.

entry.title: Editorial: tweak wording in image alternative text section
entry.content: Editorial: tweak wording in image alternative text section

entry.title: Change order of firing pagehide and visibility change steps in unload
entry.content:
Change order of firing pagehide and visibility change steps in unload

Part of #3957. See also discussion in
https://github.com/w3c/page-visibility/issues/39.

Note that we're already running visibility change steps before firing pageshow,
so after this change we have up-to-date visibility when either pagehide or
pageshow is fired.
